botanical_details.genus: Fuchsia can be deciduous or evergreen shrubs or trees, rarely perennials, with opposite or whorled leaves and usually pendent flowers with conspicuous tubular calyx, 4 spreading sepals and 4 erect petals

how_to_grow.cultivation: Ideal for growing under glass or in containers that can be brought indoors to overwinter. When in growth apply a liquid balanced fertiliser monthly. Keep just moist over winter. how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood or semi-hardwood cuttings
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to fuchsia gall mite, glasshouse whitefly, glasshouse red spider mite and aphids
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to fuchsia rust and grey moulds grey moulds and fuchsia rust
